MEASURES FOR THE SECURITY OF DOMESTIC HEIRS, LEGATEES AND CREDITORS
(1) When an authority of a foreign state has jurisdiction over a probate hearing, the court in the Republic of Slovenia in the area where the decedent has died shall, after receiving the coroner's report, issue an announcement summoning all those in the Republic of Slovenia who have any claims to the estate as heirs, legatees or creditors, to submit their claims within the period specified in the proclamation, which may not be less than 30 days and not longer than six months, starting from the day of the publication of the proclamation in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Slovenia; otherwise, the movable property from the estate shall be delivered to the competent authority of the foreign state or the person the aforementioned authority has authorised to take the property.
(2) The announcement shall be displayed on the court notice board and published in the Official Gazette of the RS, and, when necessary, it shall be published in another suitable manner; one copy of the proclamation shall be sent to the nearest diplomatic-consular representative of the foreign state in question in the Republic of Slovenia.
(3) An announcement shall not be issued when the value of the estate, before the deduction of debts, does not exceed EUR 2,000.
(4) If an announcement is not issued, the estate may not be delivered until a period of three months from the death of the foreign citizen has passed.
